page.title: 15MORE CHANGE IN BRINSWORTH
page.content: Back in the{1940's and 1950's}much of{Brinsworth}was still{farmland.} The houses in{Duncan Street, Ellis {Street and Atlas Street}were pit-owned and many miners lived there. There were some{private}houses built on the {Hall estate. Much of the farmland has been taken for other uses.{Shinn's farm}used to extend to where the{lorry park}is now. There used to be a{crisp factory}in Brinsworth but this has been converted into shops. Nowadays most of the shops are{ {self-service}and open shorter hours. Up till a few years ago some used to stay open as long as{twenty hours.}The {grocers, electrical appliance store {and bakers}have all been modernised. Prices have risen with the cost of living.{Barclay's Bank}has opened a branch in Brinsworth.
